title: [Large-Scale] Intermediate Course on Patient Education Material Development Using Visual Explanations: Mathematical Modeling and Infographic Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology, experience with graphic tools, and foundational mathematical calculation skills (ratios, proportions, graph interpretation)
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented course applying mathematics curriculum-based visual material design methodologies (measurement, analysis, proof techniques) to patient education. Includes activities converting real clinical cases into mathematical modeling.

learning_goals: Learners accurately create infographics explaining medical concepts using mathematical ratios, proportions, and graphical representations.
Learners design visual hierarchies tailored to patientsâ€™ comprehension levels using mathematical arrangement principles (e.g., matrix structures).
Learners produce educational materials using digital authoring tools in a BYOD environment and engage in iterative problem-solving incorporating peer feedback.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
